posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.60 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • It’s always OK to change your mind, so we fixed a bug that caused the image picker to open after pasting an attachment into a chat and then deciding not to send it.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.59 release
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.62 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.60.0.783-beta

28 new commits since 7.59.0.779-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.60 [1]

  • Support enabling/disabling Backups from Settings [2]

  • Reregister subscriberID for StoreKit subscription if remote Subscription missing [3]

  • Fix attachment keyboard state when cancelling pasted attachment [4]

  • Remove bridge variable [5]

  • Add mediaTierFallbackCdnNumber remote config [6]

  • Don't block attachment backup uploads on wifi if use cellular setting is enabled [7]

  • Automatically enqueue new attachment streams for backup media tier upload [8]

  • Remove isFreeTier/uploadEra placeholder methods and use BackupSettingsStore + BackupSubscriptionManager [9]

  • More aggresively dequeue backup attachment downloads we learn are unlisted [10]

  • Check credential backupLevel in BackupAttachmentUploadManager [11]

  • Delete backup too when deleting account [12]

  • Add BackupAttachmentUploadProgress to drive upload progress bar UI [13]

  • move download progress into deps bridge [14]

  • lint oops [15]

  • Bulk rename MessageBackup types [16]

  • Dump info again before zipping [17]

  • Remove observeOnce method that’s not necessary [18]

  • Remove memory leak in BackupAttachmentDownloadProgress that was breaking tests [19]

  • Remove code that’s only used by unit tests [20]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.72.0 [21]

  • Don’t inherit from SSKBaseTest [22]

  • Remove bank selection from iDEAL donations [23]

  • Show keyboard instead of attachment picker when canceling pasted image [24]

  • Clean up AppEnvironment.setUp [25]

  • Put AvatarHistoryManager.cleanupOrphanedImages off main thread [26]

  • Update release notes [27]

  • Update translations [28]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.59.0.779-beta…7.60.0.783-beta

https://community.signalusers.org/t/beta-feedback-for-the-upcoming-ios-7-58-release/68935/3?u=nuser
With the introduction of the native photo picker and private access, it might be time to retire this block of space and permission request. The existing language suggests to the user that not granting library access will limit app functionality, which is no longer the case. Instead, I propose that tapping the “+” button in the bottom left simply bring up the Photos, GIF, File, etc. icons above the keyboard.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked: This should only be the case after ‘add only’ is supported and only be detected in that case imo. Some people might want limited access to work as limited access does (unless I’m misunderstanding something)

Add only is supported as of the last public release. Honestly, the ideal situation is that Signal does not even have the capability to request full or limited access, since the native photo picker with private access is more functional. This would result in a permissions section like below:

IMG_01391273×567 55.4 KB

If the app only had the options of add only or none (private access), then there would be no need for space devoted to the permission request text or photos populating Signal’s custom photo picker. In that case, a simple row of icons for media selection would suffice.

Additionally, the user is only prompted to grant add only access when he or she attempts to save a photo if full or limited access is not granted. That’s not a selection that needs to be made when browsing for photos to send, so the text requesting access in the custom photo picker doesn’t fit.

posts.name: Delamcode
posts.cooked:
nuser:

Add only is supported as of the last public release

Oh, weird that I seem to be on the latest beta and it isn’t there? Could be an iOS bug though for all I know.

nuser:

Honestly, the ideal situation is that Signal does not even have the capability to request full or limited access, since the native photo picker with private access is more functional.

Arguably less slick, as it would either require an extra click to enter or all the other ‘plus’ items would need to be moved somewhere else. Your proposed solution (above the keyboard) still requires an extra click if the image is recent, unless these icons would be permanent, which would take up more screen space (I have an iPhone mini, so it does matter to me at least). I recommend breaking this out to its own feature request if you’d like this to happen.

nuser:

Additionally, the user is only prompted to grant add only access when he or she attempts to save a photo if full or limited access is not granted. That’s not a selection that needs to be made when browsing for photos to send, so the text requesting access in the custom photo picker doesn’t fit.

Let me know if I get anything wrong, since I don’t have this version installed. I assume that the ‘open settings’ text is there for both when permissions are set to ‘none’ and ‘add only’. Replacing the text with something like ‘${PERMISSION} permission was granted. Use the photo button below or grant full access’ (obvs not the best wording but as a poc) seems like a totally reasonable change.

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Hello!

For the past several version (since at least 7.54), a relative is seeing a crash on their iPhone when they save attachments in a receiving message containing several pictures/videos. The relevant (?) error I’m seeing in their logfile is the following:

2025/05/02 10:54:43:394  ERR❤️ [MediaGallerySections.swift:687 ensureItemsLoaded(request:transaction:)]: attachment #32 AttachmentReferenceId(ownerId: SignalServiceKit.AttachmentReference.OwnerId.messageBodyAttachment(messageRowId: 37579), orderInOwner: Optional(5)) is beyond the last section

Here’s the entire logfile: debuglogs.app (this is with 7.55, but still happens with 7.60 just earlier today).

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.61 release

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked:
I just realized, that sent gifs with low resolution appear very small (got from the gif picker). Why not resizing all gifs to the same size as its done on the desktop version?
Sending a small and then a large gif looks very crappy.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.61 release.
